result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Patrick Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA sample.

2:40 Defendant Ryan Patrick Richardson in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie files an amended information containing 1 count. Guilty to Ct#1. Probation 1 year with restitution. Larimore and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 contained in amended complaint; Larimore agrees to factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. THorie requests no contact with victim and AODA as conditions of probation. Larimore and Def adresses sentencing. Court: S/W 1 year probation: No contact with Janna Weiland or her residence as set forth on the bond, restitution ($168.80), court costs and DNA sample, AODA and follow and recommendations. Expungement upon successful completion of probation.

4:01 Defendant Ryan Patrick Richardson in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with Def. Def does not qualify for the PD.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty to both counts. Court receives and enters. THorie: $1000 signature bond with conditions. Nelson: no objections. Def has not been in the armed forces.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
